column4: Could I get some advice? I just finished building my computer (Asus M3A78-EM m/b, AMD Athlon 64 x2 5000+ processor), it boots into BIOS just fine, and I configured the CD-ROM drive to be the primary boot device. There is no other OS on the computer. I put in my Ubuntu disc (which I had checked out and I know works), and...it doesnâ€™t boot into Ubuntu. How do I get it to boot?
Can you get that disc to boot in another computer?

Just because the files contained in the ISO are there doesn't mean that the CD has its boot record. If you have burned the ISO file by copying its "file" contents, you probably aren't using El Torito (Joliet) filesystem, which provides the boot record.
In other words, if you have never been able to put that CD into another computer and get the Ubuntu boot loader, then the CD may be the problem.
